content:
• Tuesday, November 20, 2012
  • SCHL

    Scholastic (NASDAQ:SCHL) resumes trading after cutting its FY12 outlook, currently -9.2% at $28.91.

    Scholastic (NASDAQ:SCHL) resumes trading after cutting its FY12 outlook, currently -9.2% at $28.91.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM
  • SCHL

    Shares of Scholastic (NASDAQ:SCHL) are currently halted in post-session trading after it lowers...

    Shares of Scholastic (NASDAQ:SCHL) are currently halted in post-session trading after it lowers its FY13 EPS view to $1.40-$1.60 from $2.20-$2.40 and its revenue view to between $1.8B - $1.9B from $1.9B-$2.0B, which are both below consensus expectations of $2.27 per share on revenue of $1.94B respectively. The company attributes the lowered guidance to weak curriculum product sales in its Educational Technology and Services segment due to school budget constraints.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:22 PM
  • MEMS

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: MEMS +83.3%. NAVB +9.7%. VELT +6.9%. XOMA +6.3%. ANFI...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: MEMS +83.3%. NAVB +9.7%. VELT +6.9%. XOMA +6.3%. ANFI +6.0%.
    After-hours top losers: TLYS -16.9%. ZLC -12.6%. DNDN -3.4%. MBI -2.2%. CHTR -2.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • MIPS

    MIPS has resumed trading following news of CEVA's offer for its CPU core licensing business, and...

    MIPS has resumed trading following news of CEVA's offer for its CPU core licensing business, and is currently up 5% AH. That translates into nearly a $20M increase in market cap even though the difference between CEVA and Imagination's (OTCPK:IGNMF) offers is only $15M. The Street seems to think a bidding war is on the way.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • MIPS

    MIPS discloses it has received an unsolicited bid from CEVA to acquire what will remain of the...

    MIPS discloses it has received an unsolicited bid from CEVA to acquire what will remain of the company after a patent sale to an ARM-led consortium is finished for $75M in cash. That trumps a $60M offer from GPU core developer Imagination (OTCPK:IGNMF). MIPS' board is evaluating the offer. If CEVA's offer wins out, MIPS' CPU core business would complement CEVA's DSP core business, and could also yield synergies for its chip platform business. MIPS halted. CEVA -0.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM | 2 Comments
  • VELTF

    Velti (VELT) +6.9% AH after announcing certain board members, including its CEO and COO, have...

    Velti (VELT) +6.9% AH after announcing certain board members, including its CEO and COO, have bought $1.5M worth of shares. The mobile ad agency, whose shares were crushed last week after announcing plans to exit markets with very high collection times, also discloses other execs have filed to sell deferred shares, with two of them doing so to cover tax liabilities. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS) +5.5% AH after announcing a $200M stock buyback program, good for...

    Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS) +5.5% AH after announcing a $200M stock buyback program, good for repurchasing nearly 10% of outstanding shares at current levels. The buybacks will be paid for using working capital and operating cash flow. Cirrus shares have fallen hard over the last month, but rebounded some yesterday. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • SEII

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT +15%) get a boost into the close from a positive mention in a Seeking...

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT +15%) get a boost into the close from a positive mention in a Seeking Alpha article today. The post highlights the stocks solid Q3 report last week, noting that the company is in the midst of a massive turnaround effort, ant that the shares should trade many multiples higher over the near-term as investors begin to take notice.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZLC

    Zale (NYSE:ZLC): FQ1 EPS of -$0.88 misses by $0.20. Revenue of $357.5M (+1.8% Y/Y) misses by...

    Zale (NYSE:ZLC): FQ1 EPS of -$0.88 misses by $0.20. Revenue of $357.5M (+1.8% Y/Y) misses by $7M. Shares -10% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • TLYS

    Tilly's Inc (NYSE:TLYS): Q3 EPS of $0.30 in-line. Revenue of $124.9M misses by $4M. Shares...

    Tilly's Inc (NYSE:TLYS): Q3 EPS of $0.30 in-line. Revenue of $124.9M misses by $4M. Shares -10.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks (PANW -2.9%) has gradually sold off after Nomura launched coverage with a...

    Palo Alto Networks (PANW -2.9%) has gradually sold off after Nomura launched coverage with a Neutral. Altogether, five firms have adopted neutral stances on Palo Alto since Oct. 9 and 11 since the company's July IPO, generally on valuation grounds. Thanks partly to a secondary offering and Oct. quarter guidance that failed to meet very high expectations, Palo Alto shares are off nearly 30% from their September highs.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • LOGI

    Logitech (LOGI -2.6%) is near 10-year lows again after H-P reported an awful quarter for its PC...

    Logitech (LOGI -2.6%) is near 10-year lows again after H-P reported an awful quarter for its PC division, and Reuters took a close look at the peripherals maker's challenges. In addition to poor PC demand, Logitech has been hurt by a weak reception for audio products (headphones, Wi-Fi speakers, etc.) meant to exploit the mobile device boom, and has to deal with efforts from OEMs to sell their own accessories. Going forward, a lack of gesture/voice recognition solutions could present a challenge.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • HTWR

    HeartWare (HTWR +7.5%) soars after the company's implantable heart pump receives FDA approval. (PR)

    HeartWare (HTWR +7.5%) soars after the company's implantable heart pump receives FDA approval. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • MDCO

    Shares of The Medicines Company (MDCO +1.7%) move up after being initiated with an Outperform at...

    Shares of The Medicines Company (MDCO +1.7%) move up after being initiated with an Outperform at Oppenheimer. The firm says that the Street has all but ignored MDCO's strong pipeline, noting that Angiomax, its key asset, is worth around $19 per share as a stand alone product. Additionally, Phase III data from its antiplatelet-agent Cangrelor is due by early 2013 at the latest, and results from two Phase III studies of its antibiotic treatment Oritavancin should come some time in the first half of next year as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • LPI

    Laredo Petroleum (LPI -4.1%) is downgraded to Market Perform with a $22 price target (from $27)...

    Laredo Petroleum (LPI -4.1%) is downgraded to Market Perform with a $22 price target (from $27) at BMO Capital on concerns over the pace of spending and what it could mean in terms of increased leverage on an already-leveraged balance sheet or a lower planned growth rate, all while still outspending cash flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • MATN

    OxiGene (OXGN +7.7%) says results of its Phase 2 trial of Zybrestat, a treatment for patients...

    OxiGene (OXGN +7.7%) says results of its Phase 2 trial of Zybrestat, a treatment for patients with polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy, suggest that the drug, even if administered only as a single dose intravenously, may produce a transient reduction in both polyp activity and amount of subretinal fluid in patients with disease. The company also notes that further clinical testing with a more practical topical formulation in combination with photodynamic therapy may be warranted for further testing.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • ASTX

    Astex Pharmaceuticals (ASTX +12.5%) rallies after saying earlier that Phase I/II testing of its...

    Astex Pharmaceuticals (ASTX +12.5%) rallies after saying earlier that Phase I/II testing of its SGI-110 drug candidate showed that it was well tolerated in patients with leukemia or myelodysplastic syndromes at doses higher than the biologically effective dose.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • PDCO

    Patterson Companies (PDCO -7.2%) slides after missing FQ2 estimates on both counts. Net earnings...

    Patterson Companies (PDCO -7.2%) slides after missing FQ2 estimates on both counts. Net earnings fell 6.9% on slowing sales growth and weaker dental-supply demand. Gross margin also slipped to 32.4% from 32.8%. The company also lowered its FY13 EPS outlook by $0.10 to a new range of $2.00 to $2.06. The Street is at $2.13 a share.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • RSH

    Big box busts: RadioShack (RSH -3%), hhgregg (HGG -1.7%), and Conn's (CONN -1%) trades lower...

    Big box busts: RadioShack (RSH -3%), hhgregg (HGG -1.7%), and Conn's (CONN -1%) trades lower after Best Buy sets the bar even lower in the sector with broad sales declines and decreasing margins pressuring cash flow. The firms have put in a spirited effort to turn things around with mobile initiatives and an increased focus on online channels, but the math is working against them with square footage costs a heavy load to bear.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • MAKO

    Shares of Mako Surgical (MAKO -1.2%) slip due to a post late yesterday on the FDA's website...

    Shares of Mako Surgical (MAKO -1.2%) slip due to a post late yesterday on the FDA's website saying that MAKO had recalled its RIO System software, version 2.4 and is implementing software version 2.5 to address a functional issue with the existing version. Piper Jaffray says the recall had been previously disclosed, the issue looks minor and it shouldn't impact Q4 volumes. The firm reiterates an Overweight on the stock with a $28 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • ALDW

    Shares of Alon USA Partners (NYSE:ALDW) moves higher in its stock market debut after the...

    Shares of Alon USA Partners (NYSE:ALDW) moves higher in its stock market debut after the company priced its IPO of 10M shares at $16 each. Alon Partners was formed by Alon USA Energy (ALJ -1.6%) and owns crude oil refining assets in the southwest U.S. which are marketed primarily to ALJ's convenience stores. It's the 10th MLP to go public since August, and big yields have made them popular.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • INFY

    A few more companies that appear to be casualties of H-P's FQ4 disaster (I, II): IT services...

    A few more companies that appear to be casualties of H-P's FQ4 disaster (I, II): IT services firms Infosys (INFY -2.9%), Wipro (WIT -1.6%), and Sapient (SAPE -1.4%), hard drive vendors Seagate (STX -1.4%) and Western Digital (WDC -2.5%), and middleware vendor/H-P acquisition rumor subject Tibco (TIBX -3.4%).  (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • HYGS

    Shares of Hydrogenics (HYGS -2.2%) slip today after announcing the appointment of Bob Motz as...

    Shares of Hydrogenics (HYGS -2.2%) slip today after announcing the appointment of Bob Motz as CFO after the close yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • RMBS

    After soaring yesterday on a JPMorgan upgrade, Rambus (RMBS -2%) is slipping following news a...

    After soaring yesterday on a JPMorgan upgrade, Rambus (RMBS -2%) is slipping following news a U.S. judge will examine an Elpida patent sale to Rambus in advance of Elpida's acquisition by Micron (NASDAQ:MU). The decision has raised hopes among disgruntled Elpida bondholders a broader review of the Elpida-Micron deal will occur. U.S. courts can't block the deal, already approved by a Japanese bankruptcy court, but can place restrictions on the transfer of Elpida's U.S. assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • DY

    Dycom Industries (DY +9.2%) moves up today after its FQ2 beat estimates across the board late...

    Dycom Industries (DY +9.2%) moves up today after its FQ2 beat estimates across the board late yesterday. Net actually fell 8.5% however, as margins weakened amid soft capital spending trends in the telecom sector. Separately, the telecommunications contractor announced plans to buy assets of Quanta Services (PWR -0.5%) for around $275M in cash, in a deal that DY says will strengthen it's customer base, geographic scope and technical service offerings.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • NCR

    NCR (NCR +2.7%) is trading higher after JPMorgan adds the point-of-sale system vendor to its...

    NCR (NCR +2.7%) is trading higher after JPMorgan adds the point-of-sale system vendor to its Focus List. Shares recently got a lift from a major deal with Wal-Mart, but have nonetheless been range-bound for months.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • SBUX

    Shares of Teavana (TEA -2.5%) tread water as Glaucus Research Group backs its Strong Sell rating...

    Shares of Teavana (TEA -2.5%) tread water as Glaucus Research Group backs its Strong Sell rating on the stock with a warning Starbucks (SBUX +0.7%) may back off purchasing the tea retailer due to the pesticide containment of the firm's products. Neither company has commented publicly on the accusations just yet, but with Starbucks' well-advertised commitment to ethical sourcing a response seems likely. (Teavana research report .pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • DAKT

    Daktronics (DAKT +13.8%) is running today after beating FQ2 revenue estimates prior to the open....

    Daktronics (DAKT +13.8%) is running today after beating FQ2 revenue estimates prior to the open. Net earnings more than doubled as the supplier of electronic-display systems saw a sharp rise in sales to transportation, schools and theatres. Commercial sales of large video displays and electronic billboards fell 9% to $39.8M, but live events sales climbed 8.4% to $50.6M, while sales to schools and theaters jumped 26% to $21.7M. Gross margin also rose to 28.3% from 23.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • TSL

    Trina Solar (TSL -4.6%) and JinkoSolar (JKS +4%) head in opposite directions following their Q3...

    Trina Solar (TSL -4.6%) and JinkoSolar (JKS +4%) head in opposite directions following their Q3 reports (I, II). Trina, which warned last week and subsequently plunged, reported a gross margin of just 0.8% (-760 bps Q/Q) and guided for Q4 module shipments of 380MW-400MW (Q3 shipments were 380MW, -9.2% Q/Q). Jinko missed revenue forecasts, but beat EPS estimates thanks to an unexpected 150 bps Q/Q increase in gross margin to 9.9%. Q4 guidance is for module shipments of 250MW-300MW vs. 280MW in Q3. (Trina PR) (JinkoSolar PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • CAR

    Shares of Zipcar (ZIP +9.4%) pop with an upgrade from Goldman Sachs to Buy from Neutral on the...

    Shares of Zipcar (ZIP +9.4%) pop with an upgrade from Goldman Sachs to Buy from Neutral on the books. The firm cites the growing reach of Zipcar across the U.S. and now into Canada, Spain, and the U.K. The buzz from college campuses of late is Zipcar is the option that resonates with students despite efforts by Hertz and Avis to cut in.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • TLAB

    Tellabs (TLAB +4.8%) is rallying after announcing it will start buying back shares again,...

    Tellabs (TLAB +4.8%) is rallying after announcing it will start buying back shares again, leveraging $224.6M left in a program authorized back in Nov. '07. The optical networking vendor, which has been hit hard by poor industry capex and a dropoff in legacy hardware sales, will finance the purchases with its $942M cash/investment balance. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +7.2%) trades at its highest level in two months with a...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +7.2%) trades at its highest level in two months with a pair of analyst upgrades (I, II) and a CEO hiring helping wash away jitters about the firm's FQ4 earning report looming next week. For investors feeling downright giddy about the recent run, SA author First Adopter points out some red flags to consider.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +11.1%) is up sharply on news Tiger Global has taken a 9.9% stake. The news comes...

    Groupon (GRPN +11.1%) is up sharply on news Tiger Global has taken a 9.9% stake. The news comes a week after George Soros and Paul Tudor Jones disclosed they bought shares of the daily deals leader in Q3. A lot of "smart money" has poured into a company that's dealing with some serious regional challenges and a big mix shift towards regular e-commerce sales. 17.3% of Groupon's float was shorted as of Oct. 31.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 2 Comments
  • ARMH

    ARM (ARMH -3.4%) has opened lower after Raymond James downgrades shares to Outerperform from...

    ARM (ARMH -3.4%) has opened lower after Raymond James downgrades shares to Outerperform from Strong Buy - ARM closed near its 52-week high yesterday. Meanwhile, Intel (INTC -2.7%) is lower not only due to H-P's bleak PC and server sales data, but also due to a downgrade to Neutral from UBS, which is worried about the near-term impact of Paul Otellini's May retirement.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM | 13 Comments
  • HDY

    Hyperdynamics (HDY +8.3%) agrees to sell a 40% gross interest in its oil and gas exploration...

    Hyperdynamics (HDY +8.3%) agrees to sell a 40% gross interest in its oil and gas exploration concession offshore Guinea and transfer operatorship to Tullow Oil (OTCPK:TUWOY, OTCPK:TUWLF) for $27M in past costs and a share of future expenses up to $100M. Cash-strapped HDY had been looking to sell about half its 77% stake in the 25K sq. km license.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • CAL

    Shares of Brown Shoe (BWS +5%) rally after the company beats the profit estimates of analysts...

    Shares of Brown Shoe (BWS +5%) rally after the company beats the profit estimates of analysts and raises its guidance for full-year 2012. A key metric to pull out from the report is that the shoe seller was able to increase its revenue per square foot by 10.3% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures are trading in and around zero following Moody's downgrade of...

    Market preview: Stock futures are trading in and around zero following Moody's downgrade of France and after H-P takes a whopping $8.8B writedown in its FQ4 results, primarily related to its acquisition of Autonomy, with the company throwing in implications of fraud for good measure. S&P benchmark flat, H-P -11.4% and dragging some of its tech peers lower too. Later: Bernanke
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • RAVN

    Raven Industries (NASDAQ:RAVN): Q3 EPS of $0.30 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $97M (+4% Y/Y)...

    Raven Industries (NASDAQ:RAVN): Q3 EPS of $0.30 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $97M (+4% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares -6.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • GMCR

    Premarket gainers: GMCR +12%. KKD +11%. GRPN +10%. CHS +5%. QIHU +5%.Losers: HPQ -10%. CLF -6%....

    Premarket gainers: GMCR +12%. KKD +11%. GRPN +10%. CHS +5%. QIHU +5%.
    Losers: HPQ -10%. CLF -6%. BBY -6%. SHF -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • KKD

    Shares of Krispy Kreme (KKD) continue to roar higher, now up 14.4% premarket. The company's...

    Shares of Krispy Kreme (KKD) continue to roar higher, now up 14.4% premarket. The company's earnings report and guidance showed it to be firing on all cylinders as expansion doesn't cut away profitability. More than a few retail analysts are left wondering why Hostess Brands is languishing in bankruptcy, supposedly in part due to consumer distaste for sugary snacks, while Krispy Kreme is selling donuts coast to coast like wildfire.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM
  • DECK

    Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) catches an initiation from Wedbush at Outperform with a $38 price...

    Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) catches an initiation from Wedbush at Outperform with a $38 price target to boot. As is usually the case with the company, demand for Ugg boots is front and center in the analysis over its prospects. DECK -2.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • CHFS

    Sunshine Heart (SSH +17.45%) shines brightly after it receives unconditional approval from the...

    Sunshine Heart (SSH +17.45%) shines brightly after it receives unconditional approval from the FDA for a U.S. trial for its flagship C-Pulse Heart Assist System. The company expects to generate revenues from the study, which is due to start this quarter, as the FDA has granted C-Pulse CMS Category B3 status. This means trial centers will probably be reimbursed by CMS and most insurance providers. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • CJ

    C&J Energy Services (CJES) -3.8% premarket after announcing the sale of ~3.3M shares of...

    C&J Energy Services (CJES) -3.8% premarket after announcing the sale of ~3.3M shares of common stock by a single stockholder. CJES will not receive any proceeds from the sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM | 1 Comment
  • AKS

    Goldman Sachs raises its rating on AK Steel (NYSE:AKS) to Neutral from Sell as it...

    Goldman Sachs raises its rating on AK Steel (NYSE:AKS) to Neutral from Sell as it downgrades rival steel producer Cliffs Natural Resources to Sell. The firm believes AKS's balance sheet concerns have diminished with last week's capital raise and sees no further company-specific negative catalysts on the horizon. Shares have shed 34% in the past week. AKS +2.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF) -5.2% premarket after Goldman Sachs downgrades shares to...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF) -5.2% premarket after Goldman Sachs downgrades shares to Sell with a $25 price target (from $33). The firm says CLF's decision to delay its Bloom Lake expansion and curtail some operations underscores the disadvantages for high cost producers like CLF in a relatively weak iron ore market. The firm also expects lower production volume in Canada will translate into higher costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM | 6 Comments
  • HPQ

    For whom H-P's (NYSE:HPQ) FQ4 results toll: Dell (DELL-OLD) -1.9% premarket, Intel (NASDAQ:INTC)...

    For whom H-P's (NYSE:HPQ) FQ4 results toll: Dell (DELL-OLD) -1.9% premarket, Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) -1.6%, AMD -1%. H-P reported a 14% Y/Y drop in PC revenue and 12% drops in both desktop and notebook shipments. The drop in commercial PC revenue (13%) was nearly as bad as the drop in consumer PC revenue (16%).

     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM | 2 Comments
  • BBY

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY): Q3 EPS of $0.03 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $10.75B in-line. Shares -2.2%...

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY): Q3 EPS of $0.03 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $10.75B in-line. Shares -2.2% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM | 1 Comment
  • BAYZF

    Bayer (OTCPK:BAYZF) decides to avoid getting enmeshed in a bidding war for Schiff Nutrition (SHF...

    Bayer (OTCPK:BAYZF) decides to avoid getting enmeshed in a bidding war for Schiff Nutrition (SHF -5.3%), saying it won't increase its $1.2B proposal for the U.S. company after Reckitt Benckiser (OTCPK:RBGPF) offered $1.4B. "Entering a competitive bidding process in response to the November 18 Proposal (Reckitt's bid) would result in a price outside Bayer's set financial criteria," the German drug maker says.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 AM
  • HPQ

    More on H-P: The company is taking an $8.8B charge related to Autonomy just a year after buying...

    More on H-P: The company is taking an $8.8B charge related to Autonomy just a year after buying it for $10.2B. Some thought a write-down was possible, but few expected one this large. FQ1 guidance is for EPS of $0.68-$0.71, below an $0.85 consensus. Prior FY13 EPS guidance of $3.40-$3.60 is maintained, but there's probably a lot of skepticism. PC sales -14% Y/Y (-10% in FQ3), printing -5% (-3% prior), services -6% (-3% prior), enterprise hardware -9% (-4% prior), software +14% (boosted by Autonomy), financial services +1%. HPQ -10%. CC at 8AM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:54 AM | 22 Comments
  • BB

    Research in Motion (RIMM) is upgraded to Hold from Sell by Jefferies' Peter Misek, who says this...

    Research in Motion (RIMM) is upgraded to Hold from Sell by Jefferies' Peter Misek, who says this could be a $43 stock in a year if things go well. A Jeffco survey indicates carriers have a far more positive view of the BB10 than Misek expected, and he gives the phone a 20%-30% chance of success. The Ax in RIMM, according to Notable Calls, Misek's last upgrade of the stock presaged a one-month 40% move. Shares +4.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:26 AM | 6 Comments
  • CHK

    Carl Icahn ups his stake in Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) to 8.89% from 7.56% previously. Shares...

    Carl Icahn ups his stake in Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) to 8.89% from 7.56% previously. Shares +2.3% premarket. (13D)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:18 AM | 6 Comments

  • Asian and European shares fall following Moody's one-notch downgrade of France, which wasn't...

    Asian and European shares fall following Moody's one-notch downgrade of France, which wasn't totally unexpected, and ahead of a meeting of eurozone finance minsters later today, when they might finally approve more aid to Greece. Japan -0.1%, Hong Kong -0.2%, China -0.4%, India -0.1%. Euro Stoxx 50 -0.2%, London -0.3%, Paris -0.4%, Frankfurt flat, Milan -0.7%, Madrid -0.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 AM
